verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> or Song <WH7892> for the sabbath <WH7676> day. <WH3117> It is a good <WH2896> thing to give thanks <WH3034> unto the LORD, <WH3068> and to sing <WH2167> praises unto thy name, <WH8034> O most <WH5945> High: <WH5945>
To show <WH5046> forth your loving kindness <WH2617> in the morning, <WH1242> and your faithfulness <WH530> every night, <WH3915>
On an instrument of ten <WH6218> strings, and on the psaltery; <WH5035> on the harp <WH3658> with a solemn sound. <WH1902>
For you, LORD, <WH3068> have made me glad <WH8056> through your work: <WH6467> I will triumph <WH7442> in the works <WH4639> of your hands. <WH3027>
O LORD, <WH3068> how <WH4100> great <WH1431> are your works! <WH4639> and your thoughts <WH4284> are very <WH3966> deep. <WH6009>
A brutish <WH1197> man <WH376> knows <WH3045> not; neither <WH3808> does a fool <WH3684> understand <WH995> this. <WH2063>

When the wicked <WH7563> spring <WH6524> as the grass, <WH6212> and when all <WH3605> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> do flourish; <WH6692> it is that they shall be destroyed <WH8045> for ever: <WH5703>
But you, LORD, <WH3068> are most high <WH4791> for ever more. <WH5769>

For, see, <WH2009> your enemies, <WH341> O LORD, <WH3068> for, see, <WH2009> your enemies <WH341> shall perish; <WH6> all <WH3605> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> shall be scattered. <WH6504>
But my horn <WH7161> shall you exalt <WH7311> like the horn of an unicorn: <WH7214> I shall be anointed <WH1101> with fresh <WH7488> oil. <WH8081>
My eye <WH5869> also shall see <WH5027> my desire on my enemies, <WH7790> and my ears <WH241> shall hear <WH8085> my desire of the wicked <WH7489> that rise <WH6965> up against <WH5921> me.
The righteous <WH6662> shall flourish <WH6524> like the palm <WH8558> tree: he shall grow <WH7685> like a cedar <WH730> in Lebanon. <WH3844>
Those that be planted <WH8362> in the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068> shall flourish <WH6524> in the courts <WH2691> of our God. <WH430>
They shall still <WH5750> bring <WH5107> forth <WH5107> fruit <WH5107> in old <WH7872> age; <WH7872> they shall be fat <WH1879> and flourishing; <WH7488>
To show <WH5046> that the LORD <WH3068> is upright: <WH3477> he is my rock, <WH6697> and there is no <WH3808> unrighteousness <WH5766> in him.
